member.summary: The list of arguments for an action

member.name: T:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceDefinitionModel
member.summary: This is the model for the physical device. It is what we see the device as, and what the supported function are.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceDefinitionModel.Functions
member.summary: The functions that this device is capable of performing. This may not be all of the functions. But its all the functions we support so deal with it.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceDefinitionModel.Type
member.summary: The type of this device. This is a string. LIGHT, TV whatever

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceDefinitionModel.Manufacturer
member.summary: The manufacturer name of this device

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceDefinitionModel.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for this definition

member.name: T:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceFunctionModel
member.summary: The device funtion model. This represents all of the functions which a device is capable of performing.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceFunctionModel.ArgumentType
member.summary: The argument type of the function. This is the actual value type that this takes. STRING, INT, DOUBLE

member.name: T:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel
member.summary: This models a device in terms of of smart home. This contains information, along with all of the functions which are supported. Also the actual product definition for this device are actually included in this thing.

member.name: M:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel.#ctor(HomeHub.Common.Devices.Device)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for this device. This is just a guid. It has nothing to do with the product. It is just a way for us to address this thing.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel.Name
member.summary: The name of this device. Need I say more. This is the name you give the device.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel.Home
member.summary: THe unique identifier for the home which this device belongs too.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel.Description
member.summary: The string description for this device. For now this field is always blank.

member.name: P:HomeHub.Service.Common.Models.Devices.DeviceModel.Definition
member.summary: The definition model for this device. This contains information about what this device is and what functions it supports.
